intro: Uragoga orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco uragoga, is a flowering plant native to the Orinoco River basin in South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas near rivers. Uragoga orinocensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil along riverbanks.
